column5: They say it depends on the type of code - it is required upon acceptance when "This policy applies to submissions that include scripts for novel analyses, new methodologies, and for simulations. We do not require authors to make code available when used for standard analyses, creating figures or anything that does not affect the reproducibility of the results."

column4: proceedings of the national academy of sciences: usa
column5: A statment of data sharing plans is required for submission. All materials must be avaiable for editors and reviewers during peer review. All materials need to be stored in a community-approved public repositories prior to publication.
